action.action-desc: Mr. Kim of New Jersey introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Armed Services

form.official-title: To make certain improvements to child care services provided by the Secretary of Defense.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Military Child Care Transparency and Expansion Act.

section.header: Improvements to child care services provided by the Secretary of Defense

subsection.header: Expansion of pilot program To provide financial assistance to members of the Armed Forces for in-Home child care
subsection.text: Section 589(b) of the William M. (Mac) Thornberry National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2021 (Public Law 116â€“283; 10 U.S.C. 1791 note) is amended by striking five locations and inserting six locations.

subsection.header: Wait times for child care services at military child development centers

paragraph.text: Not later than 90 days after the date of the enactment of this Act, the Secretary of Defense shall publish and maintain on a website of the Department of Defense, accessible by members of the Armed Forces, waiting lists for child care services at military child development centers.

On the website described in paragraph (1), the Secretary shall publish a tool that uses data collected by the Secretary to estimate how long a member assigned to serve at a military installation will likely wait before receiving child care services at the military child development center of such installation.
